intro: Sidalcea malviflora var. stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or meadows. Sidalcea malviflora var. stellata is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
